sen.j: 盆栽（ぼんさい）とは、草木を鉢に植えて、枝ぶり、葉姿、幹の肌、根及び鉢の総称、もしくはその姿全体を鑑賞する趣味。
sen.e: Bonsai is an inclusive term referring to plants planted in a pot, their foliage, shape of leaves, bark on the trunk, roots and the pot, and also to the hobby of enjoying all of this form.
Bonsai is an inclusive term referring to plants planted in a pot, their foliage, shape of leaves, bark on the trunk, roots and the pot, and also to the hobby of enjoying all of this form.
Bonsai is an inclusive term referring to plants planted in a pot, their foliage, shape of leaves, bark on the trunk, roots and the pot, and also to the hobby of enjoying all of this form.

sen.j: また、その植物の、野外で見られる大木の姿を、鉢の上に縮尺して再現することを目指すものである。
sen.e: Furthermore, it seeks to recreate in these plants the shape of large trees that can be seen outdoors on a smaller scale in a pot.
Furthermore, it seeks to recreate in these plants the shape of large trees that can be seen outdoors on a smaller scale in a pot.
Furthermore, it seeks to recreate in these plants the shape of large trees that can be seen outdoors on a smaller scale in a pot.

sen.j: そのために剪定を施したり、自然の景観に似せるために枝を針金で固定し時に屈曲させあるいは岩石の上に根を這わせたりと様々な技巧を競うのも楽しみの一つとされる。
sen.e: Therefore the branches are pruned and fixed with wire to imitate the aesthetic of nature and sometimes the roots are bent or made to creep over rocks and taking up the challenge of using a variety of techniques is part of the fun.

Therefore the branches are pruned and fixed with wire to imitate the aesthetic of nature and sometimes the roots are bent or made to creep over rocks and taking up the challenge of using a variety of techniques is part of the fun.

Therefore the branches are pruned and fixed with wire to imitate the aesthetic of nature and sometimes the roots are bent or made to creep over rocks and taking up the challenge of using a variety of techniques is part of the fun.

sen.j: 施肥、剪定、針金掛け、水やりなど手間と時間をかけて作る。
sen.e: Time and effort is exerted with fertilizing, pruning, wiring and watering.
Time and effort is exerted with fertilizing, pruning, wiring and watering.
Time and effort is exerted with fertilizing, pruning, wiring and watering.

sen.j: 生きた植物なので「完成」というものがなく、常に変化するのも魅力の一つ。
sen.e: One of the attractions is that as the plants are living, there is no moment of 'completion', but rather it is always changing.
One of the attractions is that as the plants are living, there is no moment of 'completion', but rather it is always changing.
One of the attractions is that as the plants are living, there is no moment of 'completion,' but rather it is always changing.
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を変えました。

sen.j: 中国で唐の時代に行われていた「盆景」が平安時代に日本へ入ってきて始まった。
sen.e: It began when the miniature landscaping practiced in China in the Tang Dynasty was brought to Japan in the Heian Period.
It began when the miniature landscaping practiced in China in the Tang Dynasty was brought to Japan in the Heian Period.
It began when the 'Bonkei' (miniature landscaping) practiced in China in the Tang Dynasty was brought to Japan in the Heian period.

sen.j: 江戸時代になると武士の副業としても盆栽の栽培が盛んになり、盆栽や園芸は興隆する。
sen.e: In the Edo Period, cultivation of bonsai was popular as a sideline of the warriors, and bonsai and gardening boomed.
In the Edo Period, cultivation of bonsai was popular as a sideline of the warriors, and bonsai and gardening boomed.
In the Edo period, cultivation of bonsai was popular as a sideline of the samurai, and bonsai and gardening boomed.

sen.j: 明治以降も盆栽は粋な趣味であったが、培養管理には水やりなど手間と時間が必要なために、生活環境の推移によって次第に愛好者は時間的余裕のある熟年層が多くなった。
sen.e: Even after the Meiji Era, Bonsai was a stylish hobby, however as time and effort were required for managing cultivation and watering, due to the changes in lifestyles, it gradually became a hobby of older generations who had the spare time.

Even after the Meiji Era, Bonsai was a stylish hobby, however as time and effort were required for managing cultivation and watering, due to the changes in lifestyles, it gradually became a hobby of older generations who had the spare time.

Even after the Meiji period, bonsai was a stylish hobby, however as time and effort were required for managing cultivation and watering, due to the changes in lifestyles, it gradually became a hobby of older generations who had the spare time.

sen.j: そのため、戦後から1980年代ぐらいまでの間は、年寄り臭い趣味とされた。
sen.e: Therefore, from after the war until about the 1980's, it was considered a hobby for old people.
Therefore, from after the war until about the 1980's, it was considered a hobby for old people.
Therefore, from after the war until about the 1980's, it was considered a hobby for old people.

sen.j: しかし、1990年代以降盆栽が海外でも注目を集めるとともに見直す動きが高まり、若者の間でも粋な趣味として再認識されるようになってきている。
sen.e: However, from the 1990's, bonsai gathered attention overseas and there has been a trend towards seeing it in a new light, and as a new awareness of bonsai has grown as it has become a stylish hobby among young people.

However, from the 1990's, bonsai gathered attention overseas and there has been a trend towards seeing it in a new light, and as a new awareness of bonsai has grown as it has become a stylish hobby among young people.

However, from the 1990's, bonsai gathered attention overseas and there has been a trend towards seeing it in a new light, and as a new awareness of bonsai has grown as it has become a stylish hobby among young people.

sen.j: 木を中心としたもの
sen.e: Bonsai focusing on trees
Bonsai focusing on trees
Bonsai focusing on trees

sen.j: 松柏類（マツ、シンパク、ネズ、スギなど）
sen.e: Pine/oak varieties (pine, Chinese Juniper, Needle Juniper, Cedar)
Pine/oak varieties (pine, Chinese Juniper, Needle Juniper, Cedar)
Pine and oak varieties (including pine, Chinese Juniper, Needle Juniper, Cedar)

sen.j: 実を鑑賞するもの（ウメモドキ、カキノキ、カリン (バラ科)、ヒメリンゴなど）
sen.e: Bonsai for enjoying berries (holly, persimmon, quince (rose family), crab apple)
Bonsai for enjoying berries (holly, persimmon, quince (rose family), crab apple)
Bonsai for enjoying berries (including Japanese winterberry, persimmon, quince (rose family), crab apple)

sen.j: 花を鑑賞するもの（ウメ、ボケ (植物)、サクラ、サツキなど）
sen.e: Bonsai for enjoying flowers (Plum, flowering quince(plant), cherry, azalea)
Bonsai for enjoying flowers (Plum, flowering quince(plant), cherry, azalea)
Bonsai for enjoying flowers (including Plum, flowering quince (plant), cherry, azalea)

sen.j: 葉姿を鑑賞するもの（カエデ、ケヤキ、ハゼノキ、タケなど）
sen.e: Bonsai for enjoying the leaves (maple, zelkova, Japanese wax tree, bamboo)
Bonsai for enjoying the leaves (maple, zelkova, Japanese wax tree, bamboo)
Bonsai for enjoying the leaves (including maple, zelkova, Japanese wax tree, bamboo)

sen.j: 草を中心としたもの
sen.e: Bonsai in which grass is the main feature.
Bonsai in which grass is the main feature.
Bonsai focusing on grass

sen.j: 異種の植物や造形物を組み合わせたもの（寄せ植え、彩花盆栽、マン盆栽など）
sen.e: Bonsai which are a combination of plant varieties or shapes (group planting, Saika (flowering) bonsai, Mambonsai)
Bonsai which are a combination of plant varieties or shapes (group planting, Saika (flowering) bonsai, Mambonsai)
Bonsai which are a combination of plant varieties or shapes (including group planting, Saika (flowering) bonsai, Mambonsai (bonsai decorated with a small plastic figures))

sen.j: 直幹（ちょっかん）
sen.e: Straight trunk
Straight trunk
Chokkan Style (Straight Trunk)

sen.j: 幹が上に向けて垂直に一直線に伸びている形を直幹と呼ぶ。
sen.e: Bonsai with a straight trunk growing vertically upwards are called straight trunk bonsai.
Bonsai with a straight trunk growing vertically upwards are called straight trunk bonsai.
Bonsai with a straight trunk growing vertically upwards are called Chokkan style bonsai.

sen.j: 幹が根元から樹芯へ徐々に細くなっていくのが理想である。
sen.e: The ideal is for the trunk to gradually become thinner from the roots to the tree core.
The ideal is for the trunk to gradually become thinner from the roots to the tree core.
The ideal is for the trunk to gradually become thinner from the roots to the tree core.

sen.j: これをこけ順がよいと言う。
sen.e: This is called a 'good taper'.
This is called a 'good taper'.
This is called a 'good taper.'
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を変えました。

sen.j: 枝も前後左右に順序よく出ており、枝と枝の間隔も上に行くに従って、狭くなっていくような状態を枝順がよいと言う。
sen.e: If the branches branch off in a balanced way around the trunk, left to right, front to back, and the space between branches becomes smaller further up the tree, this is called a good branch balance.
If the branches branch off in a balanced way around the trunk, left to right, front to back, and the space between branches becomes smaller further up the tree, this is called a good branch balance.
If the branches branch off in a balanced way around the trunk, left to right, front to back, and the space between branches becomes smaller further up the tree, this is called a good branch balance.

sen.j: そして根も四方八方に伸びた根張りが理想的である。
sen.e: Also it is ideal to have the roots spreading on all sides.
Also it is ideal to have the roots spreading on all sides.
Also it is ideal to have the roots spreading on all sides.

sen.j: 模様木（もようぎ）
sen.e: Curved tree
Curved tree
Moyogi Style (Curved Tree)

sen.j: 幹が左右に曲線を描くように曲がっている木を模様木と呼ぶ。
sen.e: A curved tree is one in which the trunk is twisted into a curved line from left to right.
A curved tree is one in which the trunk is twisted into a curved line from left to right.
Moyogi style bonsai is one in which the trunk is twisted into a curved line from left to right.

sen.j: こけ順が素直で、模様が前後左右にバランス良く曲がっていることが重要である。
sen.e: It is important that the taper is good and the tree curves with a form which is well-balanced all around.
It is important that the taper is good and the tree curves with a form which is well-balanced all around.
It is important that the taper is good and the tree curves with a form which is well-balanced all around.

sen.j: 枝の出し方には注意が必要であり、自然樹のように枝は曲の外側に残して、内側の枝は剪定をする。
sen.e: It is necessary to take care with the branch formation and leave the outward curving branches as in nature, while pruning the inward branches.
It is necessary to take care with the branch formation and leave the outward curving branches as in nature, while pruning the inward branches.
It is necessary to take care with the branch formation and leave the outward curving branches as in nature, while pruning the inward branches.

sen.j: 根元からの垂直線上に樹芯があると、観る者に安定感を与える。
sen.e: If the tree core is directly above the base, this gives the viewer a sense of stability.
If the tree core is directly above the base, this gives the viewer a sense of stability.
If the tree core is directly above the base, this gives the viewer a sense of stability.

sen.j: 斜幹（しゃかん）
sen.e: Angled trunk
Angled trunk
Shakan Style (Angled trunk)

sen.j: 一方向からの風に晒されていたり、障害物などがあるために根元から斜めに立ち上がり、樹芯にかけて一方向に傾いた樹形を斜幹と呼ぶ。
sen.e: If the trunk grows up at an angle, due to being exposed to a wind coming from one direction or other obstacle, and the tree is growing in one direction on an angle from the base to the core, this is called an angled trunk.

If the trunk grows up at an angle, due to being exposed to a wind coming from one direction or other obstacle, and the tree is growing in one direction on an angle from the base to the core, this is called an angled trunk.

If the trunk grows up at an angle, due to being exposed to a wind coming from one direction or other obstacle, and the tree is growing in one direction on an angle from the base to the core, this is called Shakan style bonsai.

sen.j: 枝は一方になびかないで、前後左右に伸び出しているのが特徴である。
sen.e: The characteristic of this bonsai is that the branches do not all point in one direction but extend in all directions.
The characteristic of this bonsai is that the branches do not all point in one direction but extend in all directions.
The characteristic of this bonsai is that the branches do not all point in one direction but extend in all directions.

sen.j: 吹流し（ふきながし）
sen.e: Windswept tree
Windswept tree
Fukinagashi Style (Windswept tree)

sen.j: 斜幹よりも、さらに過酷な環境に曝されて、幹も枝も一方向になびき、樹高よりも長く枝が伸びたものを、吹き流しと呼ぶ。
sen.e: Windswept trees face even more extreme environments than the angled trunk trees, and both the trunks and branches point in one direction, with the branch length being longer than the height of the tree.

Windswept trees face even more extreme environments than the angled trunk trees, and both the trunks and branches point in one direction, with the branch length being longer than the height of the tree.
Fukinagashi style face even more extreme environments than Shakan style, and both the trunks and branches point in one direction, with the branch length being longer than the height of the tree.

sen.j: これは、枝先の位置以外は半懸崖と似ている。
sen.e: These look similar to the semi-cascade, except for the position of the ends of the branches.
These look similar to the semi-cascade, except for the position of the ends of the branches.
These look similar to the semi-cascade, except for the position of the ends of the branches.

sen.j: 懸崖（けんがい）
sen.e: Cascade
Cascade
Kengai Style (Cascade)

sen.j: 海岸や渓谷の断崖絶壁に生えて、幹が下垂して生育を続ける樹木の姿を表現したものを懸崖と呼ぶ。
sen.e: Bonsai which form a cascade imitating the shape of trees growing out from sheer cliffs by the sea or ravines with the trunk growing straight down are called cascade bonsai.
Bonsai which form a cascade imitating the shape of trees growing out from sheer cliffs by the sea or ravines with the trunk growing straight down are called cascade bonsai.
Bonsai which form a cascade imitating the shape of trees growing out from sheer cliffs by the sea or ravines with the trunk growing straight down are called Kengai style bonsai.

sen.j: ちなみに、幹や枝が鉢の上縁よりも下に垂れ下がっているものを懸崖、鉢の上縁ぐらいのものを半懸崖、と呼ぶ。
sen.e: Incidentally, bonsai with trunks and branches growing downwards below the rim of the pot are called cascade bonsai and those with the trunks and branches at about the level of the rim of the pot are called semi-cascade bonsai.

Incidentally, bonsai with trunks and branches growing downwards below the rim of the pot are called cascade bonsai and those with the trunks and branches at about the level of the rim of the pot are called semi-cascade bonsai.

Incidentally, bonsai with trunks and branches growing downwards below the rim of the pot are called Kengai style bonsai and those with the trunks and branches at about the level of the rim of the pot are called Han Kengai (semi-cascade) style bonsai.

sen.j: 蟠幹（ばんかん）
sen.e: Coiled trunks
Coiled trunks
Bankan Style (Coiled trunks)

sen.j: 幹が著しく捩れているもの、または捩れて成長する性質のものを捩幹と呼び、幹が更にネジれた状態、あたかも蛇がとぐろを巻いた様な樹形を蟠幹と呼ぶ。
sen.e: Bonsai with remarkably twisted trunks are called twisted trunks (Nejikan) while those that are even more twisted or coiled like a snake are called coiled trunks (Bankan).
Bonsai with remarkably twisted trunks are called twisted trunks (Nejikan) while those that are even more twisted or coiled like a snake are called coiled trunks (Bankan).
Bonsai with remarkably twisted trunks are called Nejikan (twisted trunks) while those that are even more twisted or coiled like a snake are called Bankan style.

sen.j: 箒立ち（ほうきだち）
sen.e: Broom Bonsai
Broom Bonsai
Hokidachi Style (Broom style)

sen.j: 幹の途中から、放射状に細かく分かれてどれが主幹なのか、区別のつかなくなった樹形で、それがあたかも竹箒に似ているので箒立ちと呼ぶ。
sen.e: Bonsai with the branches spraying out from half way up the trunk such that the main branch cannot be distinguished are called broom bonsai because they look just like bamboo brooms.
Bonsai with the branches spraying out from half way up the trunk such that the main branch cannot be distinguished are called broom bonsai because they look just like bamboo brooms.
Bonsai with the branches spraying out from half way up the trunk such that the main branch cannot be distinguished are called Hokidachi style bonsai because they look just like bamboo brooms.

sen.j: 枝の素直な分岐と、分岐点と樹高などとのバランスが鑑賞のポイントになる。
sen.e: The aesthetic points are the graceful divergence of the branches and the balance of the diverging point and height of the tree.
The aesthetic points are the graceful divergence of the branches and the balance of the diverging point and height of the tree.
The aesthetic points are the graceful divergence of the branches and the balance of the diverging point and height of the tree.

sen.j: 根上り（ねあがり）
sen.e: Bonsai with exposed roots
Bonsai with exposed roots
Neagari Style (Bonsai with exposed roots)

sen.j: 厳しい生育環境により、地中で分岐した根元の部分が、風雨に晒されて表土から浮き出して露出している状態を根上りと呼ぶ。
sen.e: Exposed root bonsai are those which have been grown in a harsh environment and the roots branching off under the earth have become exposed on the surface of the topsoil due to the effects of wind and rain.

Exposed root bonsai are those which have been grown in a harsh environment and the roots branching off under the earth have become exposed on the surface of the topsoil due to the effects of wind and rain.

Neagari style bonsai are those which have been grown in a harsh environment and the roots branching off under the earth have become exposed on the surface of the topsoil due to the effects of wind and rain.

sen.j: 多幹（たかん）
sen.e: Multiple trunks
Multiple trunks
Takan Style (Multiple trunks)

sen.j: 根元から複数の幹が立ち上がったもの。
sen.e: Bonsai with more than one trunk growing up from the base.
Bonsai with more than one trunk growing up from the base.
Bonsai with more than one trunk growing up from the base.

sen.j: 幹が2本のものを双幹、3本のものを三幹、五本以上のものを株立ちと呼ぶ。
sen.e: Bonsai with two trunks are called twin trunks, those with three trunks are called triple trunks and those with five or more trunks are called clumps.
Bonsai with two trunks are called twin trunks, those with three trunks are called triple trunks and those with five or more trunks are called clumps.
Bonsai with two trunks are called Sokan (twin trunks), those with three trunks are called Sankan (triple trunks) and those with five or more trunks are called Kabudachi (clumps).

sen.j: 幹数は奇数が好まれており、2本以外の偶数は嫌われるので避ける。
sen.e: Bonsai with an odd number of trunks are preferred, while those with an even number of trunks are unpopular and avoided, except for twin trunk bonsai.
Bonsai with an odd number of trunks are preferred, while those with an even number of trunks are unpopular and avoided, except for twin trunk bonsai.
Bonsai with an odd number of trunks are preferred, while those with an even number of trunks are unpopular and avoided, except for twin trunk bonsai.

sen.j: 根連なり（ねつらなり）
sen.e: Connected roots
Connected roots
Netsuranari Style (Connected roots)

sen.j: 3本以上の複数の同樹種の根が癒着して1つに繋がっているもの、または立木が地面に倒れて地中に埋まり、元は枝であったものが幹として育ち、その枝元からも根を出して、根が一つに繋がっている様な多幹樹形である。
sen.e: These are bonsai which have the roots of more than three of the same plant connected, or in which the tree has fallen down and been buried in the earth, and what was once a branch is grown as the trunk, and the base of that branch sends out roots which are connected with the other roots.

These are bonsai which have the roots of more than three of the same plant connected, or in which the tree has fallen down and been buried in the earth, and what was once a branch is grown as the trunk, and the base of that branch sends out roots which are connected with the other roots.

These are bonsai which have the roots of more than three of the same plant connected, or in which the tree has fallen down and been buried in the earth, and what was once a branch is grown as the trunk, and the base of that branch sends out roots which are connected with the other roots.

sen.j: これと似たものに、筏吹きがある。
sen.e: There is also a similar bonsai called Ikada bonsai (raft bonsai).
There is also a similar bonsai called Ikada bonsai (raft bonsai).
There is also a similar bonsai called Ikada Style bonsai (raft bonsai).

sen.j: これも、立木が地面に倒れて、元は枝であったものが、幹として育ち多幹樹形となったもので、根連なりと違う点は、根が1ヶ所にある。
sen.e: Raft bonsai also have the tree lying on the ground and what were originally branches are grown as trunks, with the difference from connected roots being that in raft bonsai there is only one root.
Raft bonsai also have the tree lying on the ground and what were originally branches are grown as trunks, with the difference from connected roots being that in raft bonsai there is only one root.
They also have the tree lying on the ground and what were originally branches are grown as trunks, with the difference from Netsuranari style being that in Ikada style bonsai there is only one root.

sen.j: 多幹樹形と同様に、幹数は偶数を避ける。
sen.e: As with the multiple tree forms, an even number of trunks is avoided.
As with the multiple tree forms, an even number of trunks is avoided.
As with the multiple tree forms, an even number of trunks is avoided.

sen.j: 寄せ植え（よせうえ）
sen.e: Group planting
Group planting
Yoseue Style (Group planting)

sen.j: 複数の木を一つの鉢や石に植え付けたものを寄せ植えと呼ぶ。
sen.e: Bonsai with a number of different variety of trees grown in one pot or rock are called group plantings.
Bonsai with a number of different variety of trees grown in one pot or rock are called group plantings.
Bonsai with a number of different variety of trees grown in one pot or rock are called Yoseue style bonsai.

sen.j: 同樹種だけの物や、異種の植物を組み合わせた物、または造形物などと組み合わせてより創作性を高めた作品もある。
sen.e: There are also many highly creative combinations of bonsai with a group of the same plants, groups of different plants or combinations of plants with sculptures.
There are also many highly creative combinations of bonsai with a group of the same plants, groups of different plants or combinations of plants with sculptures.
There are also many highly creative combinations of bonsai with a group of the same plants, groups of different plants or combinations of plants with sculptures.

sen.j: 文人木（ぶんじんぎ）
sen.e: Literati (free style with a long thin trunk)
Literati (free style with a long thin trunk)
Bunjingi Style (Literati)

sen.j: 中国の南画に見られる様な樹形が発端。
sen.e: Originating with tree forms that appear similar to Chinese Nanga (southern school) paintings.
Originating with tree forms that appear similar to Chinese Nanga (southern school) paintings.
Originating with tree forms that appear similar to Chinese Nanga (southern school) paintings.

sen.j: 明治時代の文人達に好まれたのでこの様に呼ぶ。
sen.e: It was popular among the literati of the Meiji Era, hence the name.
It was popular among the literati of the Meiji Era, hence the name.
It was popular among the literati of the Meiji period, hence the name.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 現在では、細幹で枝数少なく枝嵩も小さいものも文人木と呼ぶ。
sen.e: Nowadays, bonsai with narrow trunks and few branches, and with the branches having a small volume are also called Literati bonsai.
Nowadays, bonsai with narrow trunks and few branches, and with the branches having a small volume are also called Literati bonsai.
Nowadays, bonsai with narrow trunks and few branches, and with the branches having a small volume are also called Bunjingi style bonsai.

tit.e: Jin and Shari Deadwood on Bonsai
Jin and Shari Deadwood on Bonsai
Jin and Shari Deadwood on Bonsai

sen.j: 枝や幹の一部分が枯れることによって、樹皮が剥がれ白色の木質部分が剥き出しになることがある。
sen.e: On some trees part of the branch or trunk may die off, and the bark peel off causing the white core of the tree to be exposed.
On some trees part of the branch or trunk may die off, and the bark peel off causing the white core of the tree to be exposed.
On some trees part of the branch or trunk may die off, and the bark peel off causing the white core of the tree to be exposed.

sen.j: こうなった部分を、枝で起こったものを神（ジン）、幹で起こったものを舎利（シャリ）と呼ぶ。
sen.e: If this happens on a branch, this part is called Jin, and if it happens on the trunk it is called Shari.
If this happens on a branch, this part is called Jin, and if it happens on the trunk it is called Shari.
If this happens on a branch, this part is called Jin, and if it happens on the trunk it is called Shari.

sen.j: 自然に起こるものだが、盆栽では彫刻刀などで削り人為的に作り出すという技法がある。
sen.e: This happens in nature, however in bonsai there is a technique of creating this effect artificially by peeling with a chisel or other such tool.
This happens in nature, however in bonsai there is a technique of creating this effect artificially by peeling with a chisel or other such tool.
This happens in nature, however in bonsai there is a technique of creating this effect artificially by peeling with a chisel or other such tool.

sen.j: 主に真柏などの松柏に行うが、梅などにも施すことがある。
sen.e: It is usually done on pine or oak varieties such as junipers, however it is also done on plum and other trees.
It is usually done on pine or oak varieties such as junipers, however it is also done on plum and other trees.
It is usually done on pine or oak varieties such as junipers, however it is also done on plum and other trees.

sen.j: その他
sen.e: Other
Other
Other

sen.j: 埼玉県さいたま市には、盆栽村という地名がある。
sen.e: There is a village called Bonsaimura in Saitama City, Saitama Prefecture.
There is a village called Bonsaimura in Saitama City, Saitama Prefecture.
There is a village called Bonsai-mura in Saitama City, Saitama Prefecture.

sen.j: これは、関東大震災後に、東京の盆栽業者が盆栽の育成を行なうために集団で移転してきたためである。
sen.e: This originated when a group of bonsai growers moved there from Tokyo to grow bonsai after the Great Kanto Earthquake.
This originated when a group of bonsai growers moved there from Tokyo to grow bonsai after the Great Kanto Earthquake.
This originated when a group of bonsai growers moved there from Tokyo to grow bonsai after the Great Kanto Earthquake.

sen.j: EUでの輸出規制
sen.e: Export restrictions in the EU
Export restrictions in the EU
Export Restrictions in the EU

sen.j: 日本の盆栽はヨーロッパでは1970年頃から「enBonsai」として根強い人気があったが、2008年10月15日にオランダ輸出向けの庭木よりゴマダラカミキリが寄生されたものが見つかった事により輸入規制強化の緊急措置が施行された。
sen.e: Japanese bonsai, known as enBonsai, became very popular in Europe from the 1970s, however due to the discovery on October 15th, 2008, of an Asian long-horned beetle parasite on a garden tree being exported to the Netherlands, an emergency measure was taken to tighten import regulations.

Japanese bonsai, known as enBonsai, became very popular in Europe from the 1970s, however due to the discovery on October 15th, 2008, of an Asian long-horned beetle parasite on a garden tree being exported to the Netherlands, an emergency measure was taken to tighten import regulations.

Japanese bonsai, known as 'enBonsai,' became very popular in Europe from the 1970s, however due to the discovery on October 15, 2008, of an Asian long-horned beetle parasite on a garden tree being exported to the Netherlands, an emergency measure was taken to tighten import regulations.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを補足しました。

sen.j: ゴマダラカミキリが侵入しない施設で2年間生育されたもの以外は輸入を認めないとする内容であり、2009、2010年度の輸出が事実上不可能となった。
sen.e: The regulations prohibit the import of garden trees which have not been grown for over two years in a facility which prevents the infestation of Asian long-horned beetles and exports effectively became impossible in 2009 and 2010.

The regulations prohibit the import of garden trees which have not been grown for over two years in a facility which prevents the infestation of Asian long-horned beetles and exports effectively became impossible in 2009 and 2010.
